item.title: Alleged Chinese hacker tied to Silk Typhoon arrested for cyberespionage
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A Chinese national was arrested in Milan, Italy, last week for allegedly being linked to the state-sponsored Silk Typhoon hacking group, which responsible for cyberattacks against American organizations and government agencies. [...]

item.title: Public exploits released for Citrix Bleed 2 NetScaler flaw, patch now
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Researchers have released proof-of-concept (PoC) exploits for a critical Citrix NetScaler vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-5777 and dubbed CitrixBleed2, warning that the flaw is easily exploitable and can successfully steal user session tokens. [...]

item.title: Employee gets $920 for credentials used in $140 million bank heist
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers stole nearly $140 million from six banks in Brazil by using an employee's credentials from C&M, a company that offers financial connectivity solutions. [...]

item.title: Atomic macOS infostealer adds backdoor for persistent attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Malware analyst discovered a new version of the Atomic macOS info-stealer (also known as 'AMOS') that comes with a backdoor, to attackers persistent access to compromised systems. [...]

item.title: Qantas is being extorted in recent data-theft cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Qantas has confirmed that it is now being extorted by threat actors following a cyberattack that potentially exposed the data for 6 million customers. [...]

item.title: 'Batavia' Windows spyware campaign targets dozens of Russian orgs
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A previously undocumented spyware called 'Batavia' has been targeting large industrial enterprises in Russia in a phishing email campaign that uses contract-related lures. [...]

item.title: Hackers abuse leaked Shellter red team tool to deploy infostealers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Shellter Project, the vendor of a commercial AV/EDR evasion loader for penetration testing, confirmed that hackers used its Shellter Elite product in attacks after a customer leaked a copy of the software. [...]

item.title: OpenAI says GPT-5 will unify breakthroughs from different models
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI has again confirmed that it will unify multiple models into one and create GPT-5, which is expected to ship sometime in the summer. [...]

item.title: Hands on with Windows 11 Notepad's new markdown support
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Notepad now lets you use markdown text formatting on Windows 11, which means you can write in Notepad just like you could in WordPad. [...]

item.title: ChatGPT is testing disruptive Study Together feature
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI's "Study together" mode has been spotted in the wild, and it could help students prepare for exams directly from ChatGPT. [...]

item.title: Ingram Micro outage caused by SafePay ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: An ongoing outage at IT giant Ingram Micro is caused by a SafePay ransomware attack that led to the shutdown of internal systems, BleepingComputer has learned. [...]

item.title: ChatGPT Deep Research tests new connectors for more context
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: ChatGPT Deep Research, which is an AI research tool to automate research, is getting support for new connectors (integrations), including Slack. [...]
